title: On the Way Back to the Art Studio
logline: Jason and Stacey drive through the night as Jason tries to make sense of the bizarre events and the possibility that he’s caught in a scam.

setting.environment: Night; dim interior cab light from passing streetlights; quiet road.

JASON_TOWNE.objective: Understand whether he’s been pulled into an elaborate scam.

STACEY.objective: Draw out Jason’s thought process for clarity and documentation.

story_beats.description: Jason drives fast but carefully, clearly deep in thought.
Stacey asks Jason to articulate what he's thinking.
Jason expresses his confusion and anger over what’s unfolding.
Stacey probes directly: Jason might be part of a scam.
Jason confirms his fears and states his intention to investigate.

dialogue.line: Walk me through your thought process.
I want to figure out what the hell is going on.
You said you think you’re getting scammed. Tell me about that.
You heard it. You were standing there. I was just told about a scam that sounds painfully familiar.
That’s my thought process. I want to know if I’m getting scammed.

props: Stacey’s camera bag on the floor
Jason’s phone clipped to the dash

setup_payoffs.Jason’s frustration with theatrics: Motivates his desire to get answers.
setup_payoffs.Escalation of tension: Journey becomes transitional movement toward confrontation.
